topic: Historical precedents for UNGA resolutions condemning US military action
summary: UNGA passed resolutions condemning US invasions of Panama (1989) in 9 days and Grenada (1983) in 8 days
content:
Panama 1989: US invaded Dec 20, 1989. UNGA voted 75-20 on Dec 29, 1989 (Resolution 44/240) to condemn as "flagrant violation of international law" - 9 days after invasion.

Grenada 1983: US invaded Oct 25, 1983. UNGA voted 108-9 on Nov 2, 1983 (Resolution 38/7) "deeply deplores the armed intervention" - 8 days after invasion.

Both resolutions passed despite US objections. In both cases, UN Security Council resolutions were vetoed by US/UK/France.
